thread.title: Emmerdale spoiler: Pierce makes creepy sex tape with Rhona without her knowing
thread.title_full: Emmerdale spoiler: Pierce makes creepy sex tape with Rhona without her knowing

author: Kyle O'Sullivan
title: Emmerdale spoiler: Pierce makes creepy sex tape with Rhona without her knowing
text:
Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Emmerdale fans will be begging for Rhona to leave Pierce tonight when he makes a secret sex tape. 
It all starts innocently enough when a slightly tipsy Rhona returns home with some of Laurel's underwear stock. 
Pierce asks her to give him a private viewing, but seizes the opportunity to record her uncomfortably strip tease on his tablet. 
Things get a bit more intimate between the pair, but Pierce leaves the camera running. is there anything Pierce can do to make Rhona leave him? (Photo: ITV) Read More Emmerdale's Zoe Henry on her sex tape storyline: 'I was worrying about my 93-year-old Nan watching it!' 
Rhona isn't happy when she discovers she's unwillingly made a sex tape, but Pierce turns the tables by trying to make her feel guilty for not wanting to watch it. 
She tries to please him by telling him not to delete the sordid video, but this could just be the start of Pierce showing his true colours. 
Later, Pierce sees a text from Vanessa on Rhona's phone and is furious. Read More Vanessa and Pierce square up (Photo: ITV) 
He confronts Vanessa in a heated clash, leaving her determined to expose him to everyone. 
Meanwhile, Jacob finds his lucky coin in the bin and puts it in the charity box, pretending he doesn't want it anymore. David sees Jacob scrabbling around in the bin (Photo: ITV) He wants to find his lucky coin before David gets his test results (Photo: ITV) 
Elsewhere, Rebecca and Chrissie worry about Lawrence 
Also, Jai feels lonely when he sees so many happy couples around him and confesses his problems to Moira when they visit Holly's grave. 
Emmerdale airs tonight on ITV at 7.00 and 8.00pm. Like us on Facebook
